line_2: So long would last; compos'd of buds so brief;

line_2: Thro' unseen Wounds injects the stinging Grief,

line_1: "A whoreson cough (and at the fall of leaf)
line_2: " Upset him quite; — but what's the gain of grief?
A terror-breathing tale that wins belief,

line_1: "The grateful flavour of the Indian leaf,
With balmy dew from yonder leaf.
line_2: Shall melt o'er thee in tender grief;

line_1: And view the trees disrob'd of every leaf,
line_2: And every field depriv'd of every sheaf!

line_1: Here Moss-grown Trees expand the smallest Leaf,
line_2: Here half an Acre's Corn is half a Sheaf,

line_1: The slimy mallow waves her silky leaf;
line_2: Hardy and high, above the slender sheaf,

line_1: O'er frost-nipp'd bud or bursting leaf.
line_2: While Evening sighs in seeming grief

line_1: So glitt'ring CONQUEST, from the laurel leaf
line_2: O let th' aspiring Warrior think with grief,

line_1: Or hang upon the parched leaf
line_2: Like the soft drops of silent grief,
